content.question: Which of the following explains why the rate of change of the consumer price index <math alttext="C P I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CPI)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> tends to overstate the actual inflation rate?

choices.label: Consumers will require more income to buy goods whose prices have increased.
Nominal wages do not always increase by as much as prices do.
When real wages increase, consumers can afford higher-priced goods.
Consumers tend to substitute lower-priced goods that may not be represented in the basket of goods.
The basket of goods in the base year is frequently updated with new products.

content.answer: Consumers tend to substitute lower-priced goods that may not be represented in the basket of goods.
